summary: This document is an email chain from July 10, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) staff, coordinating last-minute travel arrangements for a team member to travel to Palm Beach, Florida, for the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails discuss logistics for flights and a hotel stay on July 11-12, 2019.

persons.name: EFTA00105874
persons.context: The primary traveler requesting flight and hotel bookings to travel to Palm Beach for the Epstein case on July 11-12, 2019. They are coordinating with administrative staff.

persons.name: EFTA00105875
persons.context: A colleague who is already traveling to Palm Beach for the case and is mentioned as the reason EFTA00105874 is also traveling. They are part of the prosecution team.

connections.description: They are traveling together to Palm Beach for the Epstein case as part of the same legal/prosecution team.

events.title: Travel to Palm Beach for Epstein Case
events.description: EFTA00105874 and EFTA00105875 travel from Newark to West Palm Beach, Florida, for work related to the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: Return Travel from Palm Beach
events.description: EFTA00105874 is scheduled to depart West Palm Beach to return to Newark.

locations: West Palm Beach Marriott, 1001 Okeechobee Blvd, West Palm Beach, FL
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) was actively working on the Jeffrey Epstein case as of July 2019, with staff traveling to Palm Beach, Florida.
Travel was arranged on very short notice (requested on July 10 for travel on July 11), indicating time-sensitive case activity.
The email chain reveals internal administrative procedures (E2 profiles, travel arrangers, CWT Sato) used by the USAO SDNY for official travel.
The document does not contain the names of the prosecutors or staff, as they are redacted and represented by document identifiers (EFTA00105874, EFTA00105875).
The specific hotel (West Palm Beach Marriott) and detailed flight preferences are documented, showing the logistical planning for the trip.
